issue.title: [arrow] Remove the suffix .dll of ws2_32

labels.name: category:port-bug
labels.description: The issue is with a library, which is something the port should already support

labels.name: info:needs-maintainer-attention
labels.description: Lets the current 'on rotation' vcpkg maintainer know they need to look at this.

repository.name: vcpkg
repository.description: C++ Library Manager for Windows, Linux, and MacOS

issue.body:
Fixes #38305, the upstream issue https://github.com/apache/arrow/issues/41340 and PR https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/41341.

- [x] Changes comply with the [maintainer guide](https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg-docs/blob/main/vcpkg/contributing/maintainer-guide.md).
- [ ] ~~SHA512s are updated for each updated download.~~
- [ ] ~~The "supports" clause reflects platforms that may be fixed by this new version.~~
- [ ] ~~Any fixed [CI baseline](https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/blob/master/scripts/ci.baseline.txt) entries are removed from that file.~~
- [ ] ~~Any patches that are no longer applied are deleted from the port's directory.~~
- [x] The version database is fixed by rerunning `./vcpkg x-add-version --all` and committing the result.
- [x] Only one version is added to each modified port's versions file.

issue.title: [C++][CMake][Windows] Don't use .dll suffix for system libraries such as ws2_32

repository.name: arrow
repository.description: Apache Arrow is the universal columnar format and multi-language toolbox for fast data interchange and in-memory analytics

issue.body:
### Describe the bug, including details regarding any error messages, version, and platform.

We should use import library (`.lib`) no DLL (`.dll`) to link with system libraries. So `target_link_libraries(... ws2_32.dll)` is wrong. (But it seems that it works with MSVC...)

We should use `target_link_libraries(... ws2_32.lib)` (use `.lib`) or `target_link_libraries(... ws2_32)` (no extension).

See also: https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/command/target_link_libraries.html#command:target_link_libraries

> A plain library name: The generated link line will ask the linker to search for the library (e.g. `foo` becomes `-lfoo` or `foo.lib`).

See also: https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/pull/38295/files#r1574568441

### Component(s)

C++

body: I'm a bit new to vcpkg, but if I'm reading the change correctly it looks like it would only apply to arrow version 16.0, is that right?  Would it be possible to apply to 15.0.0 as well?

> Would it be possible to apply to 15.0.0 as well?

Not in the vcpkg registry.
You may do that in a local overlay port based on the old revision.

Thanks, this is all still a bit unclear to me as I said I'm rather new to vcpkg.
I'm not sure what port-versions are exactly and why 16.0.0 port-version 1 has the fix, 0 does not ( and 15.0.2 port-version 1 does not have the fix either )
Can you point my in the right direction on how to apply the patch for 15.0.0 using a local overlay?

The main thing I think I dont understand is why the patch isnt getting applied.  If I see that the arrow/portfile.cmake that I have checked out has the new patch listed in the patch list, why isnt it getting applied ( what is controlling this so that only 16.0.0 version 1 is getting the patch applied )
Please open a proper new issue.
